cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,29th October 1919.(Repeated to Minister, Tehran.)(Received 30th, .11 p.m.)14675. Malleson wires as followsContinuation of my 024-34 dated 25th October. Reported by Merv agent on17th October that Bolsheviks have collected force of 500 camels from Turcomans, andthat according to local rumour they contemplate a move into Khorasan as soon astroops become available.2. With reference to above, we are moving Kashmir Mountain Battery from east Persian line of communications to Meshed, and have placed 1/124th BaluchistanInfantry under orders from India. Should' situation demand it: before latter unitreaches him, we have authorised Malleson to draw upon line of communication postsup to one Battn. His force at Meshed will theivconsist of one Cavalry regiment, oneMountain Battery and two Battns. as approved in your No. 4118 of 20th October.
